title: [Large-scale] Autonomous Driving System Operator Training: Strengthening Social Safety Nets and Technological Utilization Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental automotive operation knowledge, digital device proficiency, basic understanding of traffic regulations and civic safety
context.additional_context: Systematic education from foundational understanding of ADAS/ADS technology to practical simulations. Comprehensive evaluation of real-world driving scenario application skills and awareness of social responsibility through project-based assessments. Particularly addresses traffic system changes brought by autonomous driving technology and strategies for protecting citizens' rights.

learning_goals: Learners explain core autonomous driving technologies (ADAS/ADS) and principles of social safety
Learners perform driver-system interaction procedures for Level 1-3 autonomous vehicles at 80% accuracy in simulation environments, improving decision-making skills from a civic safety perspective
Learners identify technological and institutional limitations of autonomous driving systems in real-road scenarios and propose team-based mitigation strategies and policy improvement directions

resources: Autonomous vehicle control principles animation resources

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
